meta.title: Get All Customers - Customers - Customers v3 - Management APIs - API Reference
meta.description:
Returns a list of Customers. Optional filter parameters can be passed in.

Notes

Attribute names are not available on the customer object.

blocks.data:
Returns a list of Customers. Optional filter parameters can be passed in.

**Notes**

Attribute names are not available on the customer object.

### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Customers | modify | `store_v2_customers` |
|  Customers | read-only | `store_v2_customers_read_only` |
| Stored Payment Instruments| modify | `store_stored_payment_instruments`|
| Stored Payment Instruments| read-only | `store_stored_payment_instruments_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).
* **Name**: X-Auth-Token
* **Location**: header

date_modified:min.description: Filter items by mininum date_modified. `date_modified:min=2019-09-04T:00:00:00` or `date_modified:min=2019-09-04`

date_modified:max.description: Filter items by maximum date_modified `date_modified:max=2018-09-05T13:45:03` or `date_modified:max=2019-09-04`

name:in.description: Filter items by first_name and last_name. `name=james moriarty`

name:like.description:
Filter items by substring in first_name and last_name.
`name:like=moriarty, sherlock`
Concatenates the first_name and last_name fields.

registration_ip_address:in.description:
Filter items by registration_ip_address. If the customer was created using the API, then registration address is blank.
`registration_ip_address:in=12.345.6.789`

include.description:
Indicates whether to include customer sub-resources:
 * `addresses` - customer addresses
 * `storecredit` - store credit
 * `attributes` - customer attributes and address attributes
 * `formfields` - customer and address form fields

 `include=addresses,storecredit,attributes,formfields`

sort.description: Sort items by date_created, date_modified, or last_name:* `date_created:asc` - date created, ascending* `date_created:desc` - date created, descending* `last_name:asc` - last name, ascending* `last_name:desc` - last name, descending * `date_modified:asc` - date modified, ascending* `date_modified:desc`- date modified, descending  Example: `sort=last_name:asc`

email.description: The email of the customer. Must be unique.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

registration_ip_address.description: The IP address from which this customer was registered.

tax_exempt_category.description: The tax exempt category code for the customer.

customer_group_id.description: ID of the group which this customer belongs to.

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the customer.

date_modified.description: The date on which the customer was modified.

date_created.description: The date of which the customer was created.

force_password_reset.description: If `true`, this customer will be forced to change password on next login.

addresses.description: Array of customer addresses. Limited to 10

first_name.description: The first name of the customer address.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer address.

company.description: The company of the customer address.

city.description: The city of the customer address.

postal_code.description: The postal code of the customer address.

country_code.description: The country code of the customer address.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer address.

address_type.title: Address Type
address_type.description: The address type. Residential or Commercial

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the address.

country.description: The country name of the customer address.

form_fields.description: Array of form fields. Controlled by `formfields` parameter.

attributes.description: Array of customer attributes. Limited to 10.

date_created.description: The date the customer attribute was created

date_modified.description: The date the customer attribute was modified

form_fields.description: Array of form fields. Controlled by `formfields` parameter.

accepts_product_review_abandoned_cart_em.description: It determines if the customer is signed up to receive either product review or abandoned cart emails or recieve both emails.

channel_ids.title: customerChannelIds
channel_ids.description: Array of channel ids the Customer has access to.

meta.title: _metaCollection
meta.description: Data about the response, including pagination and collection totals.

pagination.title: Pagination
pagination.description: Data about the response, including pagination and collection totals.

total.description: Total number of items in the result set.

count.description: Total number of items in the collection response.

per_page.description: The amount of items returned in the collection per page, controlled by the limit parameter.

current_page.description: The page you are currently on within the collection.

total_pages.description: The total number of pages in the collection.

links.title: Links
links.description: Pagination links for the previous and next parts of the whole collection.

previous.description: Link to the previous page returned in the response.

current.description: Link to the current page returned in the response.

next.description: Link to the next page returned in the response.
